p: The major components were longifolene (33.13%), palmitic acid (9.34%), longicamphenylone (7.88%), 7(11)-Selinen-4 Î±-ol (4.37%), and humulane-1,6-dien-3-ol (4.28%) as shown in Figure 1. Results verified that the sesquiterpene hydrocarbon, longifolene, is the prevalent component in P. roxburghii bark cultivated in different regions. However, the essential oil components vary quantitatively and qualitatively regarding the used organs as well as the geographical origin [ 10, 14].
